children.text: We are excited to invite you to participate in the Robot Uprising: Micro Invaders 2024 competition!

In Micro Invaders, your task is to develop an AI (or bot) that autonomously controls two 3D printed robots on the game field. The objective is for these robots to interact with their environment and execute game strategies without human intervention. It‚Äôs a great way to put your coding and robotic skills to the test in a fun physical challenge.

Your team will have three months time over the summer to build your solutions at a relaxed pace. Our organizing team will support you through regular checkpoints, providing guidance to help you refine your robots and AI systems. This schedule is designed to accommodate learning and experimentation, making it ideal for those looking to enhance their capabilities in robotics, AI, computer vision, and more. . It may be possible to join afterwards depending on team count so far.

Have you ever had trouble with study motivation or are you looking for ways to manage and keep track of your studies? By participating in this study, you help in developing a mobile application aimed at increasing study motivation, especially for independent study. I ask you to participate regardless of your background and the state of your studies. All that is needed is that you study in higher education.

This study will be conducted as a part of my master‚Äôs thesis in the Information Processing Science degree program at the University of Oulu, and you can participate entirely remotely. Participation is completely voluntary and can be withdrawn at any point without having to tell why. All responses are kept confidential and anonymous so that no one can be identified from the responses. The data is used solely for the master‚Äôs thesis and scientific publications.

The survey is completely in English. It includes testing an early version of a gamified and persuasive application, as well as statements, to which you answer on a scale of 1-5 (1 = strongly disagree, 5 = strongly agree). In addition, you will respond to background questions and one voluntary open question. There are no right or wrong answers, instead, it is important that you answer according to your own view. Participation is best done on the computer, but it is also possible on the phone. Responding only takes about
of your time, but the results are pivotal for this study.
You can fill out the survey here:
Feel free to distribute the survey to other higher education students. The survey closes
(Finnish time), so please submit it soon.
A huge thank you and have a great day!

Calling all women interested in tech!

Join BCG Platinion, the tech strategy part of the leading management consulting firm Boston Consulting Group (BCG), in their upcoming breakfast event for women at the BCG Helsinki office on Friday, October 4.

During the morning, you will get to know BCG Platinion consultants, explore the diverse career paths the company offers and learn how BCG Platinion drives the tech agenda for clients across various industries. Have you always wanted to learn flashy kicks, punches and blocks? Do you want to improve your balance, flexibility and mobility of body? Are you in need of self-defence skills?

University of Helsinki Taekwon-do Club provides a beginners‚Äô course for all adults (over 18 years). The beginners‚Äô course starts September 22nd. Training sessions will be given in Porthania gym (Yliopistonkatu 3) on Sundays at 11:00-12:30. The course costs 70.00 ‚Ç¨, or 60‚Ç¨ if you participate with a friend. Fee includes training, membership and belt exam fees, and ITF Federation license fee. Until the beginning of September you can attend beginners' course for free!
Please, register for the beginners‚Äô course via the form¬†

Taekwon-do is a fast-paced Korean martial art that can be used for defence and offence. This martial art is especially famous for its diversity of kicking techniques and suits people from different groups of age, both as a competitive and general fitness sport.

Taekwon-do develops physical features of the body, such as coordination, agility, mobility and general fitness level. Additionally, it improves focus, perseverance and self-confidence in facing new challenges.

Taekwon-do can roughly be divided into six forms: basic techniques, patterns, sparring, special techniques, power breaking and self-defence. Further information about Taekwon-do‚Äôs forms can be found from Internation Taekwon-do Federation's or Finnish ITF Federation's website:

How can you do the most good?

Do you want to build a career that not only benefits you but also has a real positive impact on the world? Are you interested in learning and discussing the most pressing problems out there? Would you like to meet interesting people from multidisciplinary backgrounds with a shared passion for doing good? How about connecting with a global community of like-minded people?
Now you have the opportunity, as we in Effective Altruism Finland are organising an introductory program for you!

The Effective Altruism Intro Program is an intensive and rewarding 5-week program starting in early October. Every week consists of reading and group discussions on themes like effective career choices, empathy, global health, forecasting and existential risks.

Effective Altruism is a global community and movement striving to find out how we can use our resources to help others the most. The Finnish Effective Altruism community has local university groups in six cities. You can learn more at¬†
Read more about the intro program and apply by September 30th here

Have you been wondering what consulting actually means? Wonder no more! Columbia Road invites you to an excursion where we debunk consulting myths and give you a glimpse into the everyday life of a tech consultant. During the evening, you'll also hear more about our Associate Program jobs and get to enjoy some light food and refreshments. There will be plenty of time to relax and get to know CR and other students after the program, so mark your calendars for this event üóì
If we haven't met yet, here's a few facts about us!
‚≠êÔ∏è Our goal is to help our clients sell better in digital channels. Our tools for doing this include software development, marketing technology, data and design.
‚≠êÔ∏è We are already close to 150 Roadies and work in Helsinki, Tampere and Stockholm and our official language is English.
‚≠êÔ∏è Every year, we welcome students or recent graduates to kickstart their career at CR and most of them are permanently employed by us after the Associate Program.
PS. The application period for our Associate Program will open soon after the excu, so sign up for a reminder here and don‚Äôt hesitate to come and have a chat with us at the excu!

children.text: On-site excursion: Discovering Developer Careers and Development Culture at OP

Are you an IT student looking to explore the wide range of career opportunities available in software development? Are you curious about how we develop our products and services here at OP? Then join us for an exciting excursion that will give you an inside look into the world of OP's development team, as well as the chance to network with our professionals.

The excursion will take place on Wednesday, October 16th at 4 PM at OP Headquarters (Gebhardinaukio 1, 00510 Helsinki). The presentations will be in English. Don't forget to sign up for the event by October 11th to secure your spot - we have a maximum of 65 participants.
16.00 Welcome to OP & Kiitorata trainee program
16.15 From Kiitorata Trainee to Developer at OP
17.15 MANKELI - Model Augmented Non-structured Knowledge Extraction and Labeling Interface
Hope to see you on Wednesday 16th of October.
Apply here to secure your spot!

Donate blood at any Blood Service location during the campaign. During Tempaus Week, there will also be an opportunity to donate blood in Otaniemi, provided you are not a first-time donor. Remember to take your ID with you!
Mention at the beginning of the health interview that you want to participate in the Tempaus campaign.

If you have signed up for Tempaus: You will get a card and/or a proof to your Blood donating app that you have participated. By showing the proof to Tempaus committee during Tempaus Week, you will get your¬†
Blood Service will cover taxi costs if 4 people share the same ride. More information can be found on¬†
The blood donation campaign will continue and will end on the 15th of November. On the same day, there is a blood donation point at Dipoli, Otakaari 24, Espoo.
More general information about blood donating can be found on¬†

POKA's Autumn Pike Fishing Trip in the Turku Archipelago

Join us for pike fishing in the autumnal archipelago! The traditional autumn pike fishing trip of the Polytechnics' Fishing Club will take place in the Turku archipelago, specifically in Velkua. Autumn pike are hungry, and larger specimens are often found near spawning bays, making this an excellent opportunity to catch them. You don't need to be an experienced fisherman to join ‚Äì as long as you're enthusiastic about spending a day on a boat and possibly an evening in the sauna. Want to learn how to play Magic: The Gathering? This is the perfect event for you!

The gaming committee is putting together a newbie-friendly MTG game night, as we bring out easy-to-play, low-power level decks for anyone to try in the game's most popular casual format! Commander or EDH as it's also referred to as, is a multiplayer game with 100-card decks and a commander legendary creature acting as the "general" of the deck. If you've seen guild members playing MTG in the guild room before, it's most likely been a Commander game.
Just come to Otaranta Club Room on Tuesday 15.10. at 16-22! We will have a variety of decks ready to play for you, there is no need to bring one (although you can if you want!).

To help out even total beginners who have never tried the game out, we will go over the game's basic rules at the beginning of the event and place some more experienced players at each table to answer any questions you may have.
For the more experienced players, please only bring very low power decks to this event, aiming for around the power level of out-of-the-box preconstructed.
Make sure to join our TiK MTG Telegram group too!
WHERE? Otaranta Club Room @ Otaranta 8 B
WHY? To learn to play Magic!

children.text: Global Shapers Helsinki hub is looking for new hub members - Apply by October 28th! We think this could interest your¬†members and would appreciate it if you could pass it onto them.¬†

Global Shapers Helsinki hub is part of the Global Shapers Community, initiated by the World Economic Forum in 2011. We‚Äôre a network consisting of people between the ages of 18 and 33 (27 at the time of nomination) who have shown great potential for future leadership roles in society. We are a community of values driven volunteers who plan and run projects with the goal of creating local, regional and global impact. In Helsinki, our mission is to provide an inspiring space for voicing ideas and concerns, which we then follow up with our own initiatives. We are committed to facilitating positive change by sharing and harnessing varied knowledge and perspectives in order to tackle local and global challenges of our time. It is in our interest to bring together the most diverse pool of young talents, so this is why we want you to join us!

Are you a young professional or a student willing to commit your talent to world-changing projects, while being part of a unique, diverse international community? Do you have ideas you‚Äôve wanted to turn into reality for a long time? Then this is the right place for you.
Apply by October 28th by completing the following form:
For more information on our community, please visit¬†
For more information regarding the recruitment process, please contact¬†

Taekwon-do is a fast-paced Korean martial art that can be used for defence and offence. This martial art is especially famous for its diversity of kicking techniques and suits people from different groups of age, both as a competitive and general fitness sport.

Taekwon-do develops physical features of the body, such as coordination, agility, mobility and general fitness level. Additionally, it improves focus, perseverance and self-confidence in facing new challenges.

Taekwon-do can roughly be divided into six forms: basic techniques, patterns, sparring, special techniques, power breaking and self-defence. Further information about Taekwon-do‚Äôs forms can be found from Internation Taekwon-do Federation's or Finnish ITF Federation's website:
